greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A generalization of triangle A071951 (Legendre-Stirling).
comment: This triangle underlies the array entry A078741 ((3,3)-generalized Stirling2).
For the computation of the column sequences see A089505.
link: R. B. Corcino, K. J. M. Gonzales, M. J. C. Loquias and E. L. Tan, Dually weighted Stirling-type sequences, arXiv preprint arXiv:1302.4694 [math.CO], 2013.
R. B. Corcino, K. J. M. Gonzales, M. J. C. Loquias and E. L. Tan, Dually weighted Stirling-type sequences, Europ. J. Combin., 43, 2015, 55-67.
formula: G.f. for m-th column sequence (without leading zeros and m>=1) is 1/Product_{r=1..m} 1-fallfac(r+2, 3)*x with fallfac(n, k) := A008279(n, k) (falling factorials).
mathematica: max = 10; f[m_] := 1/Product[1 - FactorialPower[r + 2, 3]*x, {r, 1, m}]; col[m_] := CoefficientList[f[m] + O[x]^(max - m + 1), x]; a[n_, m_] := col[m][[n - m + 1]]; Table[a[n, m], {n, 1, max}, {m, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 01 2016 *)
xref: The column sequences (without leading zeros) are A000400 (powers of 6), A089507, A089513-4, etc.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 01 2003
